Package com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.general

Class CodePointMapper

java.lang.Object
com.phasmidsoftware.dsaipg.util.general.CodePointMapper
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparator<String>, Function<Integer,Integer>, UnaryOperator<Integer>
public class CodePointMapper extends Object implements UnaryOperator<Integer>, Comparator<String>
Class to manage code point mapping. This implementation deals with three components: the mapper, the range, and the comparator. See the constructor for explanations.

What is a codepoint? It's an integer (could be 8, 16, or more bits) that maps to a (Unicode) character. See Wikipedia: Codepoint.

  • Field Details

    • English

      public static final CodePointMapper English
      CodePointMapper to yield a value in the range 0 -> 31 which is good for English characters.

    • ASCIIComparatorExt

      public static final Comparator<String> ASCIIComparatorExt
      A comparator that compares two strings lexicographically based on their mapped ASCII values. Each character in the strings is transformed using the ASCIIMapperExt function before comparison. The comparison proceeds character by character, considering the length of the strings and defaulting to 0 for unmatched characters if strings are of unequal length. The comparison result is determined by the difference of transformed values at the first differing character. If all characters are equivalent, the strings are considered equal.

    • ASCIIExt

      public static final CodePointMapper ASCIIExt
      CodePointMapper to yield a value in the range 0 -> 255 which is good for (8-bit) ASCII characters.

    • ASCIIComparator

      public static final Comparator<String> ASCIIComparator
      A comparator for comparing two strings based on the ASCII mapping of their characters. This comparator compares strings character by character using an external ASCII mapping function. If both strings have equal character mappings up to their length, comparison falls back to comparing string lengths to determine the order.

      This utility is implemented as a lambda function and is immutable and stateless.

    • ASCII

      public static final CodePointMapper ASCII
      CodePointMapper to yield a value in the range 0 -> 255 which is good for (8-bit) ASCII characters.

    • CodePointMapper

      public CodePointMapper(String name, UnaryOperator<Integer> mapper, int range, Comparator<String> comparator)
      Constructor.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of this mapper.
      mapper - a function which takes a codePoint and returns a valid character within the defined range.
      range - an int which specifies the number of legal values that can be output by the mapper.
      comparator - a String comparator.

      public int map(int codePoint)
      Method to take a (Unicode) code point and yield an int in the appropriate range.
      Parameters:
      codePoint - a Unicode codePoint.
      Returns:
      an int which is non-negative and less than the value of range.

    • map

      public String map(String s)
      Converts a string by mapping each character using a defined mapping function.
      Parameters:
      s - the input string to be processed.
      Returns:
      a new string where each character from the input has been replaced by the result of the mapping function.
